title: Were The LAN Servers Moved?
body:
I found out that the LAN servers were supposedly hosted in Miami, so I went and checked it out. For some reason I get 60 ping compared to my 48 on the NA servers. I found an ip address for the LAN servers here(104.160.136.3): https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4efy17/how_to_check_your_ping_without_getting_into_the/

When I ping that IP address I get about 30ms. I looked up the location of this IP and it seems to be the same as the location for the NA servers(which can't be right because the ping is different).

I'd just like to know where the LAN servers are. If they are still in Miami, is the IP address I have correct and if so, why is my in-game ping so much higher than when I ping the address?

replies.body:
That appears to be an IP address from Miami, but I can't seem to ping it with "ping 66.151.33.248" in my command line. It says my request timed out, which I'm pretty sure means that my packets were sent, but the server never responded.

I'm assuming that this server won't reply due to DDoS/DoS protection. Is there an ip address I can actually ping? The IP address 104.160.131.1 actually responds and gives accurate representation of my ingame ping for the NA servers, so there should be a similar IP address for the LAN servers, right?

I did check the status page for both the servers when I pinged/actually played on them.

I really should be getting lower ping on the LAN servers because I am so much closer geographically(assuming that the NA servers are in Chicago).

If you aren't getting any reply from that server it's a pretty good sign that you've got some packet loss along the way. In that case, I'd suggest reaching out to your ISP to see if there are any current issues, and you could also hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to see if anything can be tweaked on your end.

I don't think it's packet loss because I've tried to ping it multiple times. I can still connect to the servers in game though.

So should I create a ticket about my ping being 56 to 60 on LAN but 46 to 48 on NA when I'm in FL?

If you'd like, you're more than welcome to reach out to our tech team in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). I'd still check for any packet loss just in case, but that's up to you, you'll be in good hands with our tech team regardless ^_^.

What's a good way to check for packet loss? I think the problem I'm having with pinging the server is technically just considered 100% packet loss, but is there a way to check packet loss while playing to see if that's the cause of my higher ping on the LAN servers?
You can use our [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743) to check your network logs for packet loss!

It doesn't seem like the problem is packet loss.

http://i.imgur.com/IYmOXNF.png

Looks like I'll be making a ticket. :v
